attribs.name: abilities_menu
tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The toshigami attempts to move stealthily into a strategic position to catch several PCs in its waves of fatigue spell-like ability. The kami then focuses its melee attacks on the closest PC.

Morale The toshigami isn’t in its right mind and fights to the death unless cleansed by the wards or if Iwalewa surrenders, at which point it also surrenders.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsight (Life; 60 ft.), Darkvision (60 ft.), Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: languages
attribs.current: Common; Speak with Plants, Telepathy 100 ft.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Merge with Ward (Cherry Tree), No Breath

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Hybridized Advanced Living Staff with 1 Battery (20 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLRnA7bP3MSZcfxaTL_description
attribs.current:
A kami has a specific ward—a creature with an Intelligence of –4 or lower, an object, or a location—listed in parentheses in the kami’s stat block. As a full action, a kami adjacent to its ward can merge body and mind with that ward. While merged, the kami can observe the surrounding region with its senses as if it were using its own body, as well as via any senses its ward might have. Typically, this trait allows a kami no control over its ward, although some kami (such as the tsukumogami) are exceptions. If the kami has no control over its ward, it can take no actions while merged other than to emerge from its ward as an action. The kami can emerge adjacent to the ward, provided the kami’s body is at least one size smaller than the ward. If the ward is a location, the kami can emerge at any point within that location. If the ward is destroyed while a kami is merged with it, the kami dies. If the ward is destroyed while the kami is not merged with it, the kami loses its merge with ward and fast healing traits, and the kami becomes sickened. It can take on a new ward by spending 7 days doing so, and it regains its traits and loses the sickened condition once it does.

Some kami have additional abilities and limitations relative to their wards. A toshigami claims a massive fabricated ecosystem as its ward.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLS-9pH4lUMloMB0sG_description
attribs.current: A toshigami can communicate with normal plants and plant creatures, though this doesn’t make them friendly. A normal plant’s sense of its surroundings is limited. This ability allows the toshigami to use Diplomacy and Intimidate, as well as other language-dependent effects, on normal plants and plant creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLSD5KDiHKLDqHkMUa_description
attribs.current: When a toshigami hits a target with any melee weapon, the target must succeed at a DC 21 Fortitude save to avoid having their age magically altered. When a toshigami strikes a foe, it decides to either physically increase the target’s age or mentally reduce the target’s age. If it chooses to increase the target’s physical age, the target takes 1 point of Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution drain on a failed save. If it chooses to decrease the target’s mental age, the target takes 1 point of Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma drain on a failed save. Once a target succeeds at a saving throw against touch of ages, it can no longer be affected by this ability for 1 round. This is a magical aging effect but does not actually alter the victim’s true age—it merely simulates the creeping effect of age on the flesh or causes a reversion to an increasingly infantile state of mind.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLSD5KDiHKLDqHkMUa_effect
attribs.current: Target's mental or physical abilities are drained by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLSD5KDiHKLDqHkMUa_save_effect
attribs.current: Negates and becomes immune to the effect for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MeLP4BHrGv3YscdPOVF_description
attribs.current:
Xenodruids developed the living staff, a gnarled and vineswathed pole, to use as a weapon and a sign of their allegiance. The staff itself can extend, and the vines can wrap around and entangle a target. Xenodruids on sentinel duty favor the tactical and advanced models. The elite and paragon models are more common among highly skilled warrior-mystics undertaking assault missions.

Hybridized
A weapon with the hybridized fusion replaces much of its technological functions with magic counterparts. It gains the analogue weapon special property (see page 180), and the core function of the weapon is considered to be a hybrid of magic and technology (rather than only the fusion counting as a hybrid item). A hybridized weapon still consumes ammunition and battery charges normally.

Block
Only melee weapons can have the block special property, which represents some kind of guard or crossbar that can protect toshigami from attacks by a foe it strikes in melee. When it successfully strikes a target with a melee attack using such a weapon, it gains a +1 enhancement bonus to your AC for 1 round against melee attacks from that target.

Living
Unlike simpler forms of biotech, a living weapon is not just organic material—it’s actually a simple living organism. The core function of a living weapon is based on the same scientific principles as manufactured weapons, but come about as part of its natural development and body function.

A living weapon can be affected by spells that target creatures, though it is mindless, incapable of independent action, and has no ability scores other than Constitution (which is always equal to its item level). It is subject to poisons and diseases, though it does not need to breath and is always protected as well as a creature with active environmental protection from armour. If it is forced to make a saving throw, its save bonus is always equal to its item level. If it suffers a condition that would normally cause it to take a penalty to attacks, damage, or save DCs, those penalties apply to any attack or effect created with it. Living weapons “eat” by absorbing part of the charges or fuel (or energy from some other form of ammunition) when fired. They do not sleep or breathe, cannot communicate in any way, are immune to pain effects due to their incredibly simple nervous systems, and are mindless.

If damaged, a living weapon can regain Hit Points from effects that restore Hit Points to living creatures, such as a mystic cure spell, and it regains a number of Hit Points equal to its item level each day. Toshigami can use the Life Science or Medicine skill instead of Engineering to repair a living weapon.

Powered
A melee weapon with an internal battery that must be charged to function has the powered special property, which lists its capacity and usage. Unlike with a ranged weapon, the usage is for 1 minute of operation rather than per attack, though using a powered weapon for less than 1 full minute still expends 1 full usage. The number of charges expended is equal to the usage × the number of minutes the weapon is used, rounded up to the nearest minute. Toshigami can activate the power of the weapon as part of the action used to make an attack with it, and it automatically deactivates after 1 minute.

As with ranged weapons, Toshigami can recharge the battery of a powered melee weapon using a generator or a recharging station, or it can purchase new batteries for it. If it tries to attack with a powered weapon that’s out of charges, it functions as an improvised weapon (see page 169).

Reach
Only melee weapons can have the reach special property. Wielding a weapon with reach gives Toshigami 10 feet of reach for attacks with that weapon. See Reach and Threatened Squares on page 255 for more information.

attribs.name: reach
attribs.current: 5 ft. (10 ft. with Hybridized Advanced Living Staff)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLPEg4emRvfNOlD9P0_target
attribs.current: Up to Six Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLPEg4emRvfNOlD9P0_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and effects as well as a potential death effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLPEg4emRvfNOlD9P0_save_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and partial effects as well as a potential death effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLPEg4emRvfNOlD9P0_description
attribs.current:
Toshigami twists the essence of life that flows through its targets, snuffing the spark out of weaker creatures and debilitating or disabling others. This spell’s effects depend on each target’s CR.

A creature of CR 5 or lower is slain by this spell. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it is instead reduced to 1 Hit Point.

A creature of CR 6–10 takes [[10d20]] (10d20) damage and is stunned for 3 rounds. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it takes half damage and negates the stunned effect.

A creature of CR 11–14 takes [[8d20]] (8d20) damage and is staggered for 3 rounds. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it takes half damage and negates the staggered effect.

A creature of CR 15 or higher takes [[6d20]] (6d20) damage. If it succeeds at a Fortitude saving throw, it takes half damage.

Regardless of whether the target succeeds at its saving throw, it still might die from the damage this spell deals, though in this case the spell is not a death effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLPKhuPbbxuX4l-T0K_description
attribs.current: Waves of negative energy render all living creatures in the spell’s area fatigued. This spell has no effect on a creature that is already fatigued.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLR2zqQuoLlC5abADZ_description
attribs.current:
This spell functions as lesser restoration, except it also removes temporary negative levels or 1 permanent negative level. This spell can’t be used to remove more than 1 permanent negative level from a target in a 1-week period.

Restoration heals all temporary ability damage, and it restores all points permanently drained from a single ability score (Toshigami's choice if more than one is drained). It also eliminates any fatigue or exhaustion suffered by the target, but it doesn’t remove any underlying source of fatigue or exhaustion. A target that has benefited from the removal of fatigue or exhaustion from this spell can’t benefit from either effect again for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLR6mn0yfbhUrlQG1y_target
attribs.current: Up to 13 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLR6mn0yfbhUrlQG1y_description
attribs.current: An affected creature moves and attacks at a drastically slowed rate. Creatures affected by this spell are staggered (see page 277). A slowed creature moves at half its normal speed (round down to the next 5-foot increment). Multiple slow effects don’t stack. Slow counters and negates haste.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLRC4ZaVYnVOjnR8MS_target
attribs.current: Up to 13 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLRC4ZaVYnVOjnR8MS_description
attribs.current:
The targeted creatures move and act more quickly than normal. This extra speed has several effects.

When making a full attack, a hasted creature can also take a separate move action in order to move. The movement can occur before, after, or between the attacks from the full attack. All movement must occur at the same time.

All of the hasted creature’s modes of movement (including base, burrow, climb, fly, and swim speeds) increase by 30 feet, to a maximum of twice the target’s normal speed using that form of movement. This increase counts as an enhancement bonus, and it affects the creature’s jumping distance as normal for increased speed. Multiple haste effects don’t stack. Haste counters and negates slow.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MeLRFQD1hpqo1JoLXeL_description
attribs.current:
With a touch, Toshigami heals and invigorate its target, restoring a number of Hit Points. If the target regains all of its Hit Points as a result of this healing, it can apply the remaining healing to itself. On the other hand, if this isn’t enough to restore all the target’s Hit Points, it can transfer any number of its own Hit Points to the target, healing the target that amount. It can’t transfer more Hit Points than it has or more Hit Points than the target is missing.

Mystic cure restores a number of Hit Points to your target depending on the spell’s level.

attribs.name: abilities_menu
tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Iwalewa uses its summoning ability to summon three CR 4 tsukumogamis (Alien Archive 3 62) to pepper its foes with magic missiles; it then manifests a staff to attack with. When reduced to half its Hit Points or fewer, Iwalewa casts chain surge on the PCs, targeting those who have already taken the most damage, if possible.

Morale Iwalewa isn’t in its right mind and fights to the death unless cleansed by the wards.

attribs.name: senses
attribs.current: Blindsight (Life; 60 ft.), Darkvision 60 ft., Low-Light Vision

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctgRAURrCX47ZZHdo7_description
attribs.current:
This spell summons an extraplanar creature (typically an elemental, magical beast native to another plane, or outsider, but also occasionally even extraplanar constructs). The summoned creature appears where the chinjugami designates and acts immediately on its turn. It attacks its opponents to the best of its ability. If the chinjugami can communicate with the creature, it can direct it to not attack, to attack particular enemies, or to perform other actions.

Three 4th-level Kami.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Merge with Ward (Space Station Park), No Breath

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mcth0YnYCc4RSOCaMgE_description
attribs.current: As a swift action or as part of a full attack, a chinjugami can manifest a staff in its grasp. The staff’s effective item level is equal to the chinjugami’s CR. The staff has the reach weapon special property and can deal either bludgeoning or piercing damage with each attack. On a critical hit, the chinjugami chooses one of two effects—the staff either sprouts entangling vines, applying the bind critical hit effect, or disrupts the target’s body, applying the bleed critical hit effect. A chinjugami can manifest only one staff at a time. If the kami loses hold of the staff, the weapon disintegrates.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-McthVDvkjkCuo5juuYH_description
attribs.current:
A kami has a specific ward—a creature with an Intelligence of –4 or lower, an object, or a location—listed in parentheses in the kami’s stat block. As a full action, a kami adjacent to its ward can merge body and mind with that ward. While merged, the kami can observe the surrounding region with its senses as if it were using its own body, as well as via any senses its ward might have. Typically, this trait allows a kami no control over its ward, although some kami (such as the tsukumogami) are exceptions. If the kami has no control over its ward, it can take no actions while merged other than to emerge from its ward as an action. The kami can emerge adjacent to the ward, provided the kami’s body is at least one size smaller than the ward. If the ward is a location, the kami can emerge at any point within that location. If the ward is destroyed while a kami is merged with it, the kami dies. If the ward is destroyed while the kami is not merged with it, the kami loses its merge with ward and fast healing traits, and the kami becomes sickened. It can take on a new ward by spending 7 days doing so, and it regains its traits and loses the sickened condition once it does.

Some kami have additional abilities and limitations relative to their wards. A chinjugami claims a massive fabricated ecosystem as its ward.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mcti1QFovjW1vlF2xoi_description
attribs.current: A chinjugami that is reduced to 0 Hit Points disperses into light that merges with the chinjugami’s ward. For 7 days, the chinjugami is unconscious as it regenerates its body and mind. After that time, the chinjugami regains consciousness and can reemerge from its ward. A chinjugami can be completely destroyed only if its ward is destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctefUk8yBApXUVTEdD_target
attribs.current: One primary target and up to 10 secondary targets, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. from the primary target

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctefUk8yBApXUVTEdD_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Primary Target's Electrical Equipment Shorts Out.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctefUk8yBApXUVTEdD_description
attribs.current:
Choose a primary target as well as up to 10 secondary targets within 30 feet of the primary target. The primary target must be carrying or wielding some kind of equipment that uses electricity. This spell causes the primary target’s electrical equipment to surge with deadly electricity, which arcs out to strike the secondary targets, dealing 13d12 electricity damage to all targets chosen.

If the primary target fails its Reflex save, the spell also shorts out one of that target’s electrical items (your choice) for 1 round, meaning the primary target can’t use it for that period. If the primary target negates the effect entirely (such as with evasion), the secondary targets also suffer no effects.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mctej9GiyNVmbZTvUdZ_description
attribs.current:
Similar to augury but more powerful, a divination spell can provide the chinjugami with a useful piece of advice in reply to a question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity that is to occur within 1 week. Casting this spell requires it to expend 1 Resolve Point. The advice granted by the spell can be as simple as a short phrase, or it might take the form of a cryptic rhyme or omen. If the chinjugami doesn’t act on the information, the conditions may change so that the information is no longer useful. The chance for a correct divination is 75% ([[1d100]]). If the die roll fails, it knows the spell failed, unless specific magic yielding false information is at work.

As with augury, multiple castings of divination about the same topic by the same caster use the same die result as the first divination spell and yield the same answer each time.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctexmBjrmPUHRTuamZ_description
attribs.current:
The chinjugami alters the area’s terrain and climate to a new terrain and climate type appropriate to the planet or plane. For example, it might transform a desert into plains. To cast this spell, the chinjugami must spend 10 Resolve Points along with technological gear worth 30,000 credits (which is magically augmented to do much of the terraforming, then consumed by the spell). A xenodruid mystic instead uses crystals and incenses worth 30,000 credits. This magically alters the area’s climate and normal plants to those appropriate to the new terrain, but it doesn’t affect creatures or the configuration of the ground. Transforming rocky hills into forested areas converts grasses into shrubs and small trees, but it doesn’t flatten the hills or change the animals to suit the new environment.

The chinjugami can alter the climate by one step (cold, temperate, or warm). The maximum extent of the terrain change is up to the GM, but in general it changes to a similar terrain type or by one step within that terrain type (such as from a typical forest to a forest with massive trees or light undergrowth, from a shallow bog to a deep bog, and so on).

Multiple castings of the spell in the same area can create an area with radically different terrain and climate than the surrounding land. The GM can decide that certain terrain shifts are unsustainable and shorten the duration or that some are suitable for the area and extend the duration. This spell could have many secondary effects based on the nature of the change, the type of bordering terrain, and so on; these should be determined by the GM on a case-by-case basis. For example, transforming a desert requires drawing water up from underground to sustain the plants, which could deplete the water table in nearby areas.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mctf3NE2Szp8rL9Iq7F_description
attribs.current:
The chinjugami creates a nonmagical, nontechnological, unattended object of nonliving matter. The volume of the item created can’t exceed 16 cubic feet (or 16 bulks). The chinjugami must succeed at an appropriate Engineering or Profession check to make a complex item, and it can’t create a consumable item.

4th: When the chinjugami casts creation as a 4th-level spell, it creates an object made out of vegetable matter (such as wood) that has an item level no greater than 5. The duration is 16 hours.

5th: When the chinjugami casts creation as a 5th-level spell, it creates an object made out of vegetable matter or material of a mineral nature: crystal, metal, stone, or the like. The object can’t have an item level greater 8. The duration depends on the hardness and rarity of the created object, as indicated on the following table (Starfinder Core Rulebook 347).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctfP61YCo3nDazJ0Rg_target
attribs.current: One Creature, Object, Spell, or Spellcaster; or a 20 ft.-Radius Burst

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctfP61YCo3nDazJ0Rg_description
attribs.current:
This spell functions like dispel magic, except it can end more than one spell on a target and it can be used to target multiple creatures. The chinjugami chooses to use greater dispel magic in one of three ways: a targeted dispel, an area dispel, or a counter.

Targeted Dispel: This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but the chinjugami can dispel four spells, attempting a separate dispel check for each spell. Additionally, greater dispel magic has a chance to dispel any curse that remove affliction can remove, even if dispel magic can’t dispel that effect. The DC of this check is equal to the curse’s DC.

Area Dispel: When greater dispel magic is used in this way, the spell affects everything within a 20-foot-radius burst. Attempt one dispel check and apply that check to each creature or object in the area, as if it were targeted by dispel magic. If the chinjugami doesn’t specify spells and there is more than one possible spell on the target, its targeted dispel attempts to dispel spells at random. Magic items themselves are not affected by an area dispel but additional magical effects on them may be dispelled.

For each ongoing spell effect whose point of origin is within the area of the greater dispel magic spell, apply the result of the dispel check to dispel the spell. For each ongoing spell whose area overlaps that of the greater dispel magic spell, apply the result of the dispel check to end the effect, but only within the overlapping area.

If an object or a creature that is the effect of an ongoing spell is in the area, apply the result of the dispel check to end the spell that conjured that object or creature (returning it whence it came) in addition to attempting to dispel one spell targeting the creature or object.

The chinjugami can choose to automatically succeed at your dispel check against any spell you have cast.

Counter: This functions as countering with dispel magic, but the chinjugami receives a +4 bonus to your dispel check to counter the other spellcaster’s spell.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctfXe0vKeklt7qElVn_description
attribs.current:
With a touch, the chinjugami heals and invigorates its target, restoring a number of Hit Points. If the target regains all of its Hit Points as a result of this healing, it can apply the remaining healing to itself. On the other hand, if this isn’t enough to restore all the target’s Hit Points, the chinjugami can transfer any number of its own Hit Points to the target, healing the target that amount. The chinjugami can’t transfer more Hit Points than it has or more Hit Points than the target is missing.

In addition, unlike most healing, when the chinjugami casts mystic cure as a spell of 4th-level or higher, it has two options to enhance its effects. The first option is to restore an extra 7d8 ([[7d8]]) Hit Points. The second option is to bring a target that died within 2 rounds back to life. In addition to healing such a creature, the spell returns the target to life, and the target takes a temporary negative level for 24 hours. This spell can’t resuscitate creatures slain by death effects, creatures turned into undead, or creatures whose bodies were destroyed, significantly mutilated, disintegrated, and so on.

Casting this spell doesn’t provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctgLlaPE382TlYxuS9_description
attribs.current: This spell functions as lesser remove condition, except the chinjugami removes all of the following conditions affecting the target: cowering, dazed, frightened, nauseated, panicked, paralyzed, shaken, sickened, staggered, and stunned.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctgZuiHhfNq6Et-SAR_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage, Knocked Prone, and Half Speed.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctgZuiHhfNq6Et-SAR_description
attribs.current:
The chinjugami pulls dormant mystical energy from the land and objects around it and use it to create a swirling eddy that batters its foes and can hinder their movement. The eddy deals 4d6 bludgeoning damage to each creature in the area. Additionally, creatures in the area are knocked prone and are reduced to half speed while the spell is in effect. A creature that succeeds at a Reflex save takes only half damage and is not knocked prone, but it is still reduced to half speed. Flying creatures within the eddy’s area must attempt an Acrobatics check to fly (DC equals the spell’s save DC) each round. Failure means the creature cannot move for that round.

The spell deals damage and knocks creatures prone only once. However, if a creature leaves the spell’s area and then returns, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above again (and can attempt another Reflex saving throw). Similarly, if a creature is not in this spell’s area when it is first cast but later moves into it, it is subject to the damage and other effects described above.

Small, unattended items (no more than light bulk) are also thrown around in the eddy’s area. At the end of the spell’s duration, such items land in a randomly determined space within the spell’s area.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctghuGZHn9X6pfHPZx_target
attribs.current: Up to 16 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MctghuGZHn9X6pfHPZx_description
attribs.current:
The chinjugami surrounds the target creatures with a constant and movable 1-inch shell of tolerable living conditions customized for each creature. This shell enables the targets to breathe freely in a variety of atmospheric conditions (including in corrosive, thick, thin, and toxic atmospheres), as well as underwater or in a vacuum. It also makes the targets immune to harmful gases and vapors, including inhaled diseases and poisons as well as spells with a harmful gaseous effect. In addition, the shell protects targets (and their equipment) from extreme temperatures (between –50° and 140° F) without having to attempt Fortitude saving throws, as well as extreme pressures.

Life bubble doesn’t provide protection from energy damage, negative or positive energy (such as found on the Negative and Positive Energy Planes), or radiation; it also doesn’t provide the ability to see in conditions of poor visibility (such as in smoke or fog) or the ability to move or act normally in conditions that impede movement (such as underwater).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-McteOdT1Tm7dgQjzNVK_description
attribs.current: As a swift action or as part of a full attack, a chinjugami can manifest a staff in its grasp. The staff’s effective item level is equal to the chinjugami’s CR. The staff has the reach weapon special property and can deal either bludgeoning or piercing damage with each attack. On a critical hit, the chinjugami chooses one of two effects—the staff either sprouts entangling vines, applying the bind critical hit effect, or disrupts the target’s body, applying the bleed critical hit effect. A chinjugami can manifest only one staff at a time. If the kami loses hold of the staff, the weapon disintegrates.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The contractor devils try to angle their knockback ability to fling foes into the infernal edifices.

Morale If reduced to 60 Hit Points or fewer, a contractor devil surrenders, muttering about hostile work conditions and threatening to take the issue up with management.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7l6vm1NYNOUNeLvE7_description
attribs.current: As a full action, a contractor devil can demolish objects in an adjacent 10-foot-by-10-foot cube. Any material with hardness 18 or less in the area crumbles to dust and is destroyed. Creatures and attended objects are unaffected.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7mNZdKJvD4qpcgKCd_description
attribs.current:
As a full action, a contractor devil can create a structure (or a portion thereof) in an adjacent 10-foot-by-10-foot cube. This can include walls, floors, ceilings, furniture, and the like. Simple moving parts such as doors are usable; but the worker devil can’t create complex mechanical parts, technological items, magical items, hybrid items, or traps. The conjured structure appears in a style reminiscent of the 
architecture of Hell, including jagged edges, spikes, and other such sinister décor. An infernal edifice has a hardness of 15 and 600 Hit Points per 10-foot-by-10-foot section; if shaped into hazards such as blades or spikes, the edifice deals deal 4d6 piercing damage to a creature that is forced into it.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7miwk5zrM5Aad2ozA_description
attribs.current: When a contractor devil hits with its melee attack, it deals the damage listed. If the attack roll result equals or exceeds the target’s KAC + 4, the target is knocked back 5 feet; if the attack roll equals or exceeds the target’s KAC + 9, the target is knocked back 10 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7nAcl4Gn8DwGtEB0P_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, a contractor devil can spit an iron rivet with a range increment of 30 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Md7kuv-saRVYECsXkey_description
attribs.current: When a contractor devil hits with its melee attack, it deals the damage listed. If the attack roll result equals or exceeds the target’s KAC + 4, the target is knocked back 5 feet; if the attack roll equals or exceeds the target’s KAC + 9, the target is knocked back 10 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7lFgxZDNB7GEETHGW_description
attribs.current:
The contractor devil creates a nonmagical, nontechnological, unattended object of nonliving matter. The volume of the item created can’t exceed 14 cubic feet. It must succeed at an appropriate Engineering or Profession check to make a complex item, and it can’t create a consumable item.

When the contractor devil casts creation as a 5th-level spell, it creates an object made out of vegetable matter or material of a mineral nature: crystal, metal, stone, or the like. The object can’t have an item level greater than 7. The duration depends on the hardness and rarity of the created object, as indicated on the following table.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7lFgxZDNB7GEETHGW_target
attribs.current: One nonmagical, nontechnological object of nonliving matter, up to 1 bulk/level; see text

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7lSCyR00kp2v9ux6f_description
attribs.current: The contractor devil can attempt to other contractor devils as a full action. The summoned ally cannot summon its own allies, is worth 0 experience points, and returns to the place from which it came after 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7lUMcZZlJp5EWhOMZ_target
attribs.current: One nonmagical manufactured object (or the volume of the object within a 3-ft.-radius of the touched point) or one manufactured creature touched each round

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7lUMcZZlJp5EWhOMZ_description
attribs.current:
Any unattended, manufactured (built from component parts, including metal, wood, plastic, glass, and so on) item you touch crumbles into dust, rust, and decay. If the item is so large that it can’t fit within a 3-foot radius, a 3-foot-radius volume of the material is destroyed. This is an instantaneous effect.

The contractor devil can employ entropic grasp in combat by making a melee attack against its opponent’s EAC. If it hits, it instantaneously reduce a manufactured armour’s KAC and EAC bonus by 3 (to a minimum of a +0 bonus). Damaged armour can be repaired using the Engineering skill; with a successful check, the armour’s armour bonuses are restored to their original values. Against a manufactured creature (generally constructs, but not undead), this attack instead deals 6d12 damage.

Weapons and equipment in use by an opponent are more difficult to affect with this spell. The contractor devil attempt a sunder combat manoeuvre against the item. If successful, it deals 6d6 damage to the weapon or item.

Used in combat, this spell lasts 14 rounds, and the contractor devil can make one melee attack each round on future rounds as a standard action. The target can attempt a save to negate each melee attack, but success does not end the spell.

Casting this spell doesn’t provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7lV0MgA9gO7Yta9Zu_description
attribs.current:
The contractor devil detects all technological items (even hybrid items) with charges or that replenish charges in the area, including batteries, power cells, and generators (as well as such items that are on creatures you can see, even if the creatures have hidden those items on themselves). It can’t determine if there are technological items in areas it can’t see, nor can it detect technological traps in this way.

The information this spell provides allows the contractor devil to differentiate between charged items and items that replenish charges, but it does not provide any further information nor does it tell it, for example, how many charges an item currently has or how many maximum charges it can hold. This spell can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of dirt or wood, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or any force field blocks it.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7lVXAwZzsw4a3wQp-_description
attribs.current:
The spell conjures an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs simple tasks at the contractor devil's command (a move action). It can run and fetch things, open unstuck doors, and hold chairs, as well as clean and mend. The servant can perform only one activity at a time, but it repeats the same activity over and over again if told to do so as long as you remain within range. It has an effective Strength score of 2 (so it can lift up to 20 pounds or 2 bulk or drag up to 100 pounds or 10 bulk). It can trigger traps and such, but it can’t exert enough force to activate certain pressure plates and other devices. It can’t perform any task that requires a skill check with a DC higher than 10 or that requires a check using a skill that can’t be used untrained. This servant can’t fly, climb, or swim (though it can walk on water). Its land speed is 15 feet.

The servant can’t attack in any way; it is never allowed to make attack rolls. It can’t be killed, but it dissipates if it takes 6 or more damage from area attacks; it gets no saving throws against attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Md7l-XQ8TbxsLdnlSNH_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, a contractor devil can spit an iron rivet with a range increment of 30 feet.

attribs.current:

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat If threatened, the contemplative casts greater synaptic pulse, then tries to fly into the streets, where she has more room and can call the contractor devils to her side. She uses mind thrust against martial foes and crush skull against enemy spellcasters.

Morale If reduced to 60 Hit Points or fewer, Ispenzia 4:17 attempts to escape and surrenders if prevented from fleeing, threatening dire legal action against the PCs.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Elite Hardlight Series, Zenith Laser Pistol with 2 Ultra-Capacity Batteries (100 Charges each)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7uZFtvptAK7KjZIBw_description
attribs.current: Once per day before attempting a skill check or saving throw against a creature, a contemplative can use its bonus for the skill associated with that creature’s type (such as Life Science for an ooze or Mysticism for an outsider) in place of its normal bonus.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7waBprZUGL-CUeTgZ_description
attribs.current: A contemplative’s limbs are practically vestigial. A contemplative can manipulate most tools and one-handed weapons (including small arms) without difficulty. A contemplative can’t properly wield a two-handed weapon without dedicating its telekinetic powers to supporting the weapon, and even then it takes a –4 penalty to attack rolls. It also can’t use its spell-like abilities or fly until it is no longer wielding that weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Md7rrJp6PQJvtcz3q6f_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most Common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7sMnQOA1sOP57w-b1_description
attribs.current: Ispenzia 4:17 links her mind to that of a touched creature to swiftly communicate a large amount of complex information in an instant. She decides what the target learns, limited to any amount of information that otherwise could be communicated in 10 minutes. This information comes in a series of visual images and emotional sensations, and it isn’t language dependent.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7sOcJTzpPehvCOY6W_target
attribs.current: Ispenzia 4:17 and up to six willing creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7sOcJTzpPehvCOY6W_description
attribs.current:
Ispenzia 4:17 forges a telepathic bond between herself and a number of willing creatures, each of which must have an Intelligence score of 3 or higher (or a modifier of –4 or higher). Each creature included in the link is linked to all the others. The creatures can communicate telepathically through the bond regardless of language. No special power or influence is established as a result of the bond. Once the bond is formed, it works over any distance (although not from one plane to another).

If desired, Ispenzia 4:17 can leave herself out of the telepathic bond forged. This decision must be made at the time of casting.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7t8p4p2ENH2CTetAj_effect
attribs.current: Full Damage and Target is Exhausted and Stunned for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7t8p4p2ENH2CTetAj_save_effect
attribs.current: Half Damage and Target is Fatigued for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7t8p4p2ENH2CTetAj_description
attribs.current:
Ispenzia 4:17 divines the most vulnerable portion of her opponent’s mind and overloads it with a glut of psychic information. The target can attempt a Will saving throw to halve the damage dealt by this spell. This spell has no effect on creatures without an Intelligence score.

When Ispenzia 4:17 cast mind thrust as a 6th-level spell, it deals 17d10 damage to the target. The target is exhausted and stunned for 1 round if it fails its save, and it is fatigued for 1 round if it succeeds at its saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tBLC-xj1XBN4CxuO_target
attribs.current: One Willing or Unconscious, Living Creature

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tBLC-xj1XBN4CxuO_description
attribs.current: Psychic surgery heals the target of all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma damage, and it restores all points permanently drained from the target’s Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It also eliminates all ongoing confusion, fear, and insanity effects. Psychic surgery also removes any mental afflictions that could be removed with dispel magic, as well as mental diseases. Psychic surgery removes all effects magically altering the target’s memory, even instantaneous effects, and it can restore a memory to perfect clarity (even if the memory loss is due to the mundane passage of time).

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tHDTeG2J0zmR5mda_description
attribs.current: Ispenzia 4:17 manipulates the energy that swirls around the target’s head, pulling it inward and potentially crushing its skull. She must make a ranged attack against the target’s EAC to ensure this spell hits the necessary weak spots in the target’s head, but she can add your key ability score modifier to this attack roll instead of her Dexterity modifier if it is higher. If she hits and the target fails a Fortitude saving throw, it takes 18d8 damage. If the target succeeds at its saving throw, it instead takes 4d8 damage. The target might die from damage even if it succeeds at its saving throw; in this case, the spell is not a death effect. This spell has no effect against living creatures that don’t have an anatomical head.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tJdj30F0fRgXfVcF_effect
attribs.current: Target's Intelligence and Charisma drops to 1. It also can no longer use skill associated with those abilities, cast spells, understand language, or communicate coherently.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tJdj30F0fRgXfVcF_description
attribs.current: Ispenzia 4:17 fires a scintillating ray at her target, making a ranged attack against her target’s EAC, but she can add her key ability score bonus to this attack instead of her Dexterity modifier if it is higher. If she hits and her target fails its Will saving throw, the target creature’s Intelligence and Charisma scores each drop to 1 (a modifier of –5). The affected creature is unable to use Intelligence- or Charisma-based skills, cast spells, understand language, or communicate coherently. It still knows who its friends are and can follow them and even protect them. The target remains in this state until a miracle, psychic surgery, wish, or similar spell is used to cancel the effect. It can’t be removed by effects like break enchantment.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tN2zUhEt9OWvSgKL_description
attribs.current: Ispenzia 4:17 stuns all creatures in range for 1d4 rounds. With a successful Will saving throw, a creature is instead sickened for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tUA5vg1DhFSWzFOZ_description
attribs.current:
Ispenzia 4:17 reaches into the target’s mind and modify up to 5 minutes of its memories in one of the following ways.

Eliminate all memory of an event the target actually experienced. This spell cannot negate charm person, suggestion, or similar spells.
Allow the target to recall with perfect clarity an event it actually experienced.
Change the details of an event the target actually experienced.
Implant a memory of an event the target never experienced.

Casting the spell takes 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw, Ispenzia 4:17 proceeds with the spell by spending as much as 5 minutes (a period of time equal to the amount of memory you want to modify) visualizing the memory she wishes to modify in the target. If her concentration is disturbed before the visualization is complete, or if the target moves beyond the spell’s range at any point during this time, the spell fails.

A modified memory does not necessarily affect the target’s actions, particularly if it contradicts the creature’s natural inclinations. An illogical modified memory is usually dismissed as a bad dream, a hallucination, or another similar excuse.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7taTnoHbPXJPICWiW_description
attribs.current:
This spell causes confusion in all creatures in the area, making them unable to determine their actions. Any confused creature that is attacked automatically attacks or attempts to attack its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused at the start of its next turn. Note that a confused creature will not make attacks of opportunity against any foe that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked). For confused creatures that have not been attacked, roll on the following table at the start of each affected creature’s turn each round to see what it does in that round.

A confused creature that can’t carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused target.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tdfyfXEs3kC6XnNp_effect
attribs.current: You gain access to the target's memory; see text.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Md7tdfyfXEs3kC6XnNp_description
attribs.current:
Ispenzia 4:17 gains access to the target’s memories and knowledge, and she can pry the information she wants from them involuntarily.

Ispenzia 4:17 can attempt to learn the answer to one question of her choice per round; after each question, the target can attempt a Will saving throw to end the spell. If it fails, the creature can attempt a Bluff check with a DC equal to 19. If it fails its Bluff check, she gains the answer she desires. If it succeeds at its check, she gains no information. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it answers however it chooses and she believes that wrong answer to be the truth. Her questions are purely telepathic inquiries, and the answers to those questions are imparted directly into her mind. She and the target don’t need to speak the same language, though less intelligent creatures may yield up only appropriate sensory images in answer to her questions.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7uaxcS7s0tk9vUWkR_description
attribs.current: Whenever a foe succeeds at a Will save against one of Ispenzia 4:17's spells and completely negates the effect, that foe takes 18 nonlethal damage. This is a mind-affecting pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7unow2vO6G5HZrPPz_description
attribs.current: Ispenzia 4:17 can spend 1 Resolve Point as a standard action to psychically assault the brain of a foe within 60 feet, causing incredible pressure to build in its head. If the target has 20 Hit Points or fewer, its head explodes, instantly killing the target and spreading debris in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the area must succeed at a Reflex saving throw or take [[2d6]] (2d6) slashing damage from the flying debris. A target with more than 20 Hit Points takes [[18d6]] (18d6) damage, but can attempt a Fortitude save to take only half damage. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 HP, the target’s head explodes as described above. This ability works only on a creature that has a head and would die from the loss of a head.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7uvC5PlGL1MHrwQCf_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Ispenzia 4:17 can tweaks the pain centers in the brain of a foe within 60 feet, causing it to suffer intense agony. The target must succeed at a Will save or be nauseated for 1 round. Regardless of the save, the creature becomes immune to this ability for 24 hours. This is a mindaffecting pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7v0gWolY4B3m8UWZk_target
attribs.current: One Foe Suffering a Critical Hit

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7v0gWolY4B3m8UWZk_description
attribs.current: Whenever Ispenzia 4:17 or an ally linked by her telepathic bond class feature scores a critical hit against a foe, she can spend 1 Resolve Point as a reaction to confuse that foe. The foe must succeed at a Will save or become confused for 1 round. Whether or not it succeeds at this save, the target is affected by her sow doubt ability for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7v8iov7csQxmuOSs3_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Ispenzia 4:17 can mold the subconscious fear of a foe within 60 feet into a psychic image of the most disturbing creature imaginable to the target. Only the target can see the mindkiller, and if the target succeeds at a Will save to recognize the image as unreal, the mindkiller has no effect. If the target fails this Will save, the mindkiller touches the target, which must then succeed at a Fortitude save or die from fear. On a successful Fortitude save, the target instead takes [[3d6]] (3d6) damage. Once a creature succeeds at either save against this ability, it becomes immune to this ability for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7vGMfRGGcwidgw-au_effect
attribs.current: Target becomes flat-footed, off-target, takes -2 penalty to saving throws, or -2 penalty to skill checks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7vGMfRGGcwidgw-au_save_effect
attribs.current: Target becomes flat-footed, off-target, takes -2 penalty to saving throws, or -2 penalty to skill checks for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Md7vGMfRGGcwidgw-au_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, Ispenzia 4:17 can spend 1 Resolve Point to create uncertainty in the mind of a foe within 30 feet. She chooses whether the target becomes flat-footed, becomes off-target, takes a –2 penalty to saving throws, or takes a –2 penalty to skill checks. The effect lasts for 9 rounds, unless the target succeeds at a Will save to reduce the duration to just 1 round. A creature can be affected only by one sow doubt effect. If she uses this ability on the same creature again, the new effect replaces the old effect. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: speed
attribs.current: 40 ft., Fly 30 ft. (Ex, Average) (30 ft., Fly 20 ft. in Armour)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Ziotris’ dragonkin security stand in formation in front of the Gilded Galleon and unleash breath weapon attacks at the PCs. They fire explosive plasma bolts at distant PCs or draw their longswords if approached. Confident in their superior equipment, they don’t take cover.

Morale A dragonkin security ceases fighting and surrenders if reduced to 60 Hit Points or fewer, or if their employer Ziotris is knocked out, surrenders, or issues orders to stand down.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Goleforged Plating V, Yellow Star Plasma Cannon with 1 Ultra-Capacity Battery (100 Charges), Zero-Edge Longsword

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MdI-Mqk6STcT0qE90HE_description
attribs.current:
A Longsword is a straight, double-edged blade that typically protrudes from a haft. Modern longswords are made of stainless steel, carbon steel, or, rarely, a Custom material such as titanium or bainite.

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to abilities that Target technology. While this use of the word “analogue” is not technically correct when referring to technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MdI-WGB0OA8C3wqmN1q_description
attribs.current:
Plasma cannons shoot large, explosive blasts of ionized plasma. They are difficult to use and have a relatively short range for a heavy weapon, but their impact has Devastating Effect.

Explode (5 ft.)
Explosives have the Explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When you Attack with this type of weapon or ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each Creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If you score a critical hit, it applies only to the Creature closest to the targeted intersection (you choose the Creature if several are equally close). If the Explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. Some exploding Weapons, such as smoke Grenades, don't deal damage, so they don't include the damage and damage type entries.

Unwieldy
Weapons with the unwieldy special property are large and awkward, can't be fired without cooling down first, or are otherwise difficult to use with repeated Attacks. You can't use an unwieldy weapon as part of a Full Attack (or any other action in which you could make multiple attacks), you can't Attack with it more than once per round, and you can't use it to make an Attack of Opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI-fNUTurqLI4HS7K4_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the dragonkin security can breathe a 30-foot cone of flame that deals 15d6 fire damage. A creature in the cone can attempt a Reflex save for half damage (DC = 20). A dragonkin can use this ability every [[1d4]] rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI-qViriaAjtLXTGzo_description
attribs.current: When the dragonkin security hits an enemy with a ranged attack or an attack with a weapon with the blast or explode special property, they can spend 1 Resolve Point to inflict a debilitating effect on that enemy for 8 rounds. They can choose to make the target deafened, flat-footed, or off-target (see pages 275–277), or to reduce its speeds by half (to a minimum of 10 feet). The target can negate this effect with a successful Fortitude save (DC = 20).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI-qViriaAjtLXTGzo_effect
attribs.current: Target is deafened, flat-footed, or off-target (see pages 275–277), or has its speed reduced to half.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI0-73MxGkTRp6AyPF_description
attribs.current: The dragonkin security is expert at setting things on fire with plasma. If their attack roll with a weapon in the plasma category is a 19 (the d20 shows a 19), and the attack hits their target, the target gains the burning condition. The condition deals [[1d4]] (1d4) fire damage if the weapon has an item level of 1st-6th, [[1d8]] (1d8) if its item level is 7th-14th, and [[2d8]] (2d8) if its item level is 15th or higher.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI05fsM--ve17vAgSd_description
attribs.current: The bombard fighting style emphasizes attacking multiple targets, often using grenades, and leverages substantial physical strength to control large weapons with significant recoil. At higher levels, the dragonkin security can use launchers, missiles, and other heavy weapons.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI0BHat-LLuocpHNT2_description
attribs.current: The hit-and-run fighting style focuses on tactical movement as the dragonkin security moves in and out of combat. They use ranged weapons but fight close up, and they can even mix ranged and melee attacks. Their abilities allow them to move even when they make full attacks and to avoid getting locked down by their enemies.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI0HdystkPDIYQ2LnJ_description
attribs.current: The dragonkin security increases the range increment of their thrown grenades by 5 × their Strength bonus. In addition, they’re able to salvage enough materials to create a grenade without paying for it. Creating a grenade takes 10 minutes. They can create any grenade whose item level is less than 14, but this grenade is unstable and only they can use it effectively. If anyone else tries to use the grenade, it is a dud. They can have only one grenade created by this ability at one time (if they create a new grenade using this ability, the old grenade no longer works).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI0lMjG4il1-zO5dtB_description
attribs.current: The dragonkin security can use their physical power to steady their weapon and make their attacks more dangerous. As a full action, they can make a single ranged attack that deals additional damage equal to their Strength bonus to all targets. They can use this ability in conjunction with the automatic, explode, or unwieldy special property (see pages 180–182).

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI0r3ar87pfjGcJeTr_description
attribs.current: The dragonkin security gains Opening Volley as a bonus feat. If they already have this feat, choose a bonus combat feat instead. At 9th level, they can use Opening Volley on both their first and second turns in combat.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdI0vRt-9rpRFLsnzsf_description
attribs.current: When the dragonkin security makes a full attack, they can make up to three attacks instead of two attacks. They take a –6 penalty to these attacks instead of a –4 penalty.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdIBZ5ilst8JcXjA4-y_description
attribs.current: If the troll hits the same target with two claw attacks during the same turn, it can attempt a bite attack against that target with a –6 penalty to the attack roll.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdIBmgK02v17ZBWcQSN_description
attribs.current: The troll can reffect some effects back at attackers or casters within 100 feet by spending 1 Resolve Point to do so, limited by the following parameters. If an attack misses the troll by 5 or fewer, as a reaction the troll can reflect the attack back at the attacker. The reflected attack deals the damage the troll would have taken, up to 30 damage (Reflex DC 20 for half). Similarly, if a spell of 4th level or lower targets the troll directly and fails to overcome the troll’s SR, as a reaction the troll can reflect the spell back at its caster as if the caster had been the target. This ability doesn’t work on effects that include the troll as one of multiple targets.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Excruciating pain from their transformation now eclipses any rationality the trolls might have had. They attack with wild abandon and little semblance of tactics.

Morale The trolls are overconfident due to a heady mixture of agony and sense of invulnerability, and they fight to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdh-ZX9lCrg8JdbTLzq_description
attribs.current: A skittermander whelp that hits with a bite attack automatically initiates a special combat manoeuvre against its target (this does not take an action) with a +4 racial bonus. If successful, the skittermander whelp moves into the target’s space without provoking an attack of opportunity and attaches to the target. The whelp gains partial cover, (though not against attacks made by the target) as well as a +2 circumstance bonus to melee attacks and damage rolls, but it can attack only the creature to which it is attached. The target (or an ally adjacent to the target) can remove an attached skittermander whelp with a successful DC 10 Strength check as a move action.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Azlanti Secret Agent|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Azlanti Secret Agent|engines_status}@{Azlanti Secret Agent|power_core_status}@{Azlanti Secret Agent|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The secret agents try to keep out of melee range, using improved uncanny mobility to move without provoking attacks of opportunity, and debilitating trick to make their foes off-target. They focus ranged fire on enemy spellcasters and non-human targets over human targets.

Morale The Azlanti secret agents fight to the death and will kill themselves rather than submit to capture.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Master of Disguise (3/Day, 130 Minutes or 13 Minutes (DC 21)), Operative Exploits (Improved Uncanny Mobility), Specialization (Spy)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Estex Suit IV, Aurora Arc Pistol with 2 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges each), Ultrathin Dagger

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mdh0lJJE3YjrMgjbcdW_description
attribs.current:
The thinness and lightness of daggers make them easy to technology—that are so fine, their edges blur. Ultrathin daggers have sharp, double-edged blades. Most daggers are available with fixed, folding, or retractable blades.

Analog
This weapon does not use any advanced electronics, Computer systems, or electrical power sources. It is immune to abilities that Target technology. While this use of the word “analogue” is not technically correct when referring to technology, use of the term in this way has become Common throughout The Pact Worlds.

Operative
An Operative can use the trick Attack class feature with a weapon that has this special property. Any character can add her Dexterity Modifier rather than her Strength Modifier on melee Attack rolls with Weapons with this special property.

Thrown (20 ft.)
Ranged Weapons that must be thrown and melee Weapons that can be thrown as a Ranged Attack have the thrown special property and a listed Range Increment. The Azlanti Secret Agent applies their Strength Modifier to damage rolls for thrown Attacks. After they throw a weapon, it lands near theur Target and they must recover it if they want to Attack with it again.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mdh0rWaqJRsfOpmStd7_description
attribs.current:
Arc pistols fire deadly, stunning blasts of electricity at Ranged Targets. They have a two-pronged emitter that directs the electrical blast and a bulky chamber that holds the capacitor.

Stun
The Azlanti Secret Agent can set a weapon with the stun special property to stun mode (or reset it to Normal mode) as a Move Action. While in stun mode, all the weapon's Attacks are nonlethal.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdh1cPjEKZgHGwqdNnb_description
attribs.current: When the Azlanti Secret Agent succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdh1fwxD59vWG821Cy-_description
attribs.current: When making a full attack using only melee weapons with the operative special property or small arms, the Azlanti Secret Agent can make up to four attacks instead of two.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdh1kUF3yXxS1viuuAD_description
attribs.current: The Azlanti Secret Agent can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, they can move up to their speed. Whether or not they moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making their attack, attempt a Bluff, Disguise, Intimidate, or Stealth check with a DC equal to 20 + their target’s CR. If they succeed at the check, they deal 7d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. They can’t use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Diamond Carbon Skin, Banshee Sonic Pistol with 1 Super-Capacity Battery (80 Charges), Peacmaker wth 1 Standard Battery (20 Charges), Concealed Azlanti Storage Device (see Development)

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat Konsuvias casts telepathic bond on himself and his Azlanti agents.

During Combat Konsuvias casts subjective reality, choosing whichever opponent seems to be dealing the most damage. If all his comrades fall, Konsuvias casts greater synaptic pulse.

Morale Konsuvias fights to the death and will kill himself rather than submit to capture.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Mdim6hE3pZ8c0HlzpYn_description
attribs.current:
This more advanced combat baton, known as a Peacemaker, is a light metal rod that discharges a pulse that can be strong enough to knock a Target to the ground.

Operative
An Operative can use the trick Attack class feature with a weapon that has this special property. Any character can add her Dexterity Modifier rather than her Strength Modifier on melee Attack rolls with Weapons with this special property.

Powered (capacity 20, usage 2)
A melee weapon with an internal Battery that must be charged to function has the powered special property, which lists its Capacity and Usage. Unlike with a Ranged weapon, the usage is for 1 minute of operation rather than per Attack, though using a powered weapon for less than 1 full minute still expends 1 full usage. The number of charges expended is equal to the usage x the number of minutes the weapon is used, rounded up to the nearest minute. You can activate the power of the weapon as part of the action used to make an Attack with it, and it automatically deactivates after 1 minute.

As with Ranged Weapons, Konsuvias can Recharge the Battery of a powered melee weapon using a generator or a recharging station, or he can purchase new batteries for it. If he tries to Attack with a powered weapon that's out of charges, it functions as an improvised weapon.

Stun
Konsuvias can set a weapon with the stun special property to stun mode (or reset it to Normal mode) as a Move Action. While in stun mode, all the weapon's Attacks are nonlethal.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MdimEV2Cc5UAtR5DpZJ_description
attribs.current:
Sonic pistols have a stocky barrel capped with a concave resonating chamber that amplifies and directs its sonic blast. They use high-intensity sound to shake molecules apart.

Boost (1d10)
Konsuvias can Charge up a weapon with this special property as a Move Action. When he does, he increases the weapon's damage by the listed amount on the next Attack he makes with the weapon. Boosting expends charges from the weapon equal to its usage value. This increases the weapon's damage and is multiplied on a critical hit. Boosting a weapon more than once before firing it doesn't have any extra Effect, and the extra Charge dissipates if the weapon is not fired by the end of his next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdimd3OUTwUMEGTOum6_description
attribs.current: Konsuvias' links his mind to that of a touched creature to swiftly communicate a large amount of complex information in an instant. He decides what the target learns, limited to any amount of information that otherwise could be communicated in 10 minutes. This information comes in a series of visual images and emotional sensations, and it isn’t language dependent.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdimftRZcD1h43o2pEe_target
attribs.current: Konsuvais plus up to 5 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdimftRZcD1h43o2pEe_description
attribs.current:
Konsuvias forges a telepathic bond between himself and a number of willing creatures, each of which must have an Intelligence score of 3 or higher (or a modifier of –4 or higher). Each creature included in the link is linked to all the others. The creatures can communicate telepathically through the bond regardless of language. No special power or influence is established as a result of the bond. Once the bond is formed, it works over any distance (although not from one plane to another).

If desired, Konsuvias can leave himself out of the telepathic bond forged. This decision must be made at the time of casting.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mdimo52oB8gzev37vQ5_target
attribs.current: Up to 18 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mdimo52oB8gzev37vQ5_effect
attribs.current: Target is influenced to take a suggested action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mdimo52oB8gzev37vQ5_description
attribs.current: This spell functions as suggestion, except it can affect more creatures. All of the affected creatures are subject to the same suggestion.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdimsOtZe8A9eJEpO23_description
attribs.current: Choose one object or creature Konsuvias can see within long range (1040 feet). He alters his perceptions to become convinced the target is an illusion. For him, the target becomes transparent and does not create sound or smell. Until the spell ends, he can move through the target unimpeded and the target can move through him. The target’s nonmagical attacks can’t harm him, and the target’s magical attacks deal half damage to him. The target’s non-damaging magical abilities have only a 50% chance of affecting him, and he is immune to all its sonic, language-dependent, and scent-based attacks. However, his attacks deal no damage to the target, and his magical abilities don’t affect the target at all. He or the target can affect each other normally through intermediaries. For instance, while the target would be immune to the direct effects of his charm monster spell, if he charmed another creature that then attacked the target creature, the target would not be immune to the damage from that attack.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-Mdin9wPRu54NBIAOqCC_description
attribs.current:
Konsuvias fires a bright purple ray at his target, making a ranged attack against his target’s EAC, but he can add his wisdom score bonus to this attack instead of his Dexterity modifier if it is higher.

If Konsuvias hits and his target fails its Will saving throw, he establishes a telepathic link with the target’s mind and can control its actions. If he and the target have a common language, he can generally force the target to perform as he desires, within the limits of its abilities. If no common language exists, he can communicate only basic commands, such as “Come here,” “Go there,” “Fight,” and “Stand still.” He knows what the target is experiencing, but he doesn’t receive direct sensory input from it, nor can it communicate with him telepathically. Once he has given a dominated creature a command, it continues to attempt to carry out that command to the exclusion of all other activities except those necessary for day-to-day survival (such as sleeping, eating, and so forth). Changing his orders or giving a dominated creature a new command is a move action.

By concentrating fully on the spell (a standard action), Konsuvias can receive full sensory input as interpreted by the mind of the target, though it still can’t communicate with him. He doesn’t actually see through the target’s eyes, but he still gets a good idea of what’s going on.

The target resists this control, and any target forced to take actions against its nature can attempt a new saving throw with a +2 bonus. Obviously self-destructive orders are not carried out. Once control is established, the range at which it can be exercised is unlimited as long as he and the target are on the same plane. He doesn’t need to see the target to control it.

If Konsuvias doesn’t spend at least 1 round concentrating on the spell each following day, the target can attempt a new saving throw to throw off the domination. He can be prevented from exercising control or using the telepathic link while the target is under the effects of some spells, but such effects don’t automatically dispel the domination.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinDqZtBH9tPd-uwSO_target
attribs.current: One creature, object, spell, or spellcaster; or a 20-ft.-radius burst

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinDqZtBH9tPd-uwSO_description
attribs.current:
This spell functions like dispel magic, except it can end more than one spell on a target and it can be used to target multiple creatures. Konsuvias choose to use greater dispel magic in one of three ways: a targeted dispel, an area dispel, or a counter.

Targeted Dispel: This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but Konsuvias can dispel four spells, attempting a separate dispel check for each spell. Additionally, greater dispel magic has a chance to dispel any curse that remove affliction can remove, even if dispel magic can’t dispel that effect. The DC of this check is equal to the curse’s DC.

Area Dispel: When greater dispel magic is used in this way, the spell affects everything within a 20-foot-radius burst. Attempt one dispel check and apply that check to each creature or object in the area, as if it were targeted by dispel magic. If Konsuvias doesn’t specify spells and there is more than one possible spell on the target, his targeted dispel attempts to dispel spells at random. Magic items themselves are not affected by an area dispel but additional magical effects on them may be dispelled.

For each ongoing spell effect whose point of origin is within the area of the greater dispel magic spell, apply the result of the dispel check to dispel the spell. For each ongoing spell whose area overlaps that of the greater dispel magic spell, apply the result of the dispel check to end the effect, but only within the overlapping area.

If an object or a creature that is the effect of an ongoing spell is in the area, apply the result of the dispel check to end the spell that conjured that object or creature (returning it whence it came) in addition to attempting to dispel one spell targeting the creature or object.

Konsuvias can choose to automatically succeed at his dispel check against any spell you have cast.

Counter: This functions as countering with dispel magic, but Konsuvias receive a +4 bonus to your dispel check to counter the other spellcaster’s spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinGilLkIwvGyFywUm_description
attribs.current: Konsuvias stuns all creatures in range for 1d4 rounds. With a successful Will saving throw, a creature is instead sickened for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinLHCU4cLgePw0OGP_target
attribs.current: Up to 16 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinLHCU4cLgePw0OGP_description
attribs.current: Konsuvias restore a number of Hit Points to a number of targets. Choose one of these targets within 10 feet of him; if that target regains all of its Hit Points as a result of this healing, he can apply the remaining healing to himself. On the other hand, if this isn’t enough to restore all of that target’s Hit Points, he can transfer any number of his own Hit Points to that target, healing the target that amount. He can’t transfer more Hit Points than he has or more Hit Points than the target is missing.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinTsMBkHQs5sGDtnC_description
attribs.current:
This spell causes confusion in all creatures in the area, making them unable to determine their actions. Any confused creature that is attacked automatically attacks or attempts to attack its attackers on its next turn, as long as it is still confused at the start of its next turn. Note that a confused creature will not make attacks of opportunity against any foe that it is not already devoted to attacking (either because of its most recent action or because it has just been attacked). For confused creatures that have not been attacked, roll on the following table at the start of each affected creature’s turn each round to see what it does in that round.

A confused creature that can’t carry out the indicated action does nothing but babble incoherently. Attackers are not at any special advantage when attacking a confused target.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinZ2wTjHKHypx3zov_target
attribs.current: to 16 Creatures, no two of which can be more than 30 ft. apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MdinZ2wTjHKHypx3zov_description
attribs.current: Each round, Konsuvias concentrates on one target within range. He knows if the target deliberately and knowingly speaks a lie by discerning disturbances in its aura caused by lying. The spell does not reveal the truth or uncover unintentional inaccuracies, and it doesn’t necessarily reveal evasions. Each round, he can concentrate on a different target.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdimNajeVQ-LHSFSAYF_description
attribs.current: Even creatures that resist Konsuvias' dominance can’t shake the lingering echoes of his mind. When a creature succeeds at a saving throw against one of his mind-affecting charm or compulsion spells or spell-like abilities and negates the effect, it takes a –1 penalty to AC, attack rolls, and skill checks until the beginning of his next turn. This is a mind-affecting effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdimQZXI29L13tfuXyv_description
attribs.current: When Konsouvias uses a mind-affecting charm or compulsion spell or spell-like ability against a target benefiting from an active spell that protects against his attack, he automatically becomes aware of the presence of such defences, and can spend 1 Resolve Point as part of casting the spell to attempt a caster level check to dispel the highest-level such spell, as if he had cast dispel magic.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdimVVrFW7ruU2QyY6w_description
attribs.current: Konsuvias' forced amity ability functions as charm monster.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdimVVrFW7ruU2QyY6w_effect
attribs.current: Target is affected by the Charm Monster spell.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MdimZBZC0QlZqexU670_description
attribs.current: When one of Konsuvias' mind-affecting charm or compulsion spells or spell-like abilities ends, the target loses all memory that it was magically controlled or influenced. That creature still remembers the actions it took, but may be confused by them.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Thing from Beyond Time|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Thing from Beyond Time|engines_status}@{Thing from Beyond Time|power_core_status}@{Thing from Beyond Time|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat If the thing from beyond time hears the PCs coming, it casts haste on itself.

During Combat The thing from beyond time uses interplanetary teleport each round to position itself adjacent to a lightly armoured target or away from foes who use primarily melee weapons. It then attacks with its tongue to drain a target’s mind. Since it wants to return home, the thing voluntarily fails any saving throws against dismissal or similar effects.

Morale If reduced to 100 or fewer Hit Points, the thing from beyond time casts greater invisibility on itself before resuming its attacks. It then fights to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdm7BLhTYnVtypgdKeC_description
attribs.current: A hound of Tindalos can use interplanetary teleport or plane shift only when adjacent to a fixed angle in the physical environment. Temporary angles are insufficient, as are angles that also include curves.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdm7JrYmhwyLrFG4lLE_description
attribs.current: Hounds of Tindalos can sense their prey, which is any creature that violates the laws of time and space, including trying to use magic to enter the Drift. A hound senses such creatures as if it had blindsense with a range of 120 feet, and the hound always knows the direction toward its prey. This directional sense works at any distance and across planar boundaries. If the prey is protected from divination, the hound must attempt a check, rolling 1d20 + 17 against a DC that equals 11 + the caster level or CR of the creator of the antidivination effect. On a success, the hound ignores the effect. If the check fails, the hound can’t try again and can’t sense the prey while the effect lasts.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdm7JrYmhwyLrFG4lLE_target
attribs.current: Creatures that Break the Laws of Time and Space

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-Mdm7lvsDR8DH09ZQdtf_description
attribs.current: When the thing from beyond time hits with its barbed tongue, its target must succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude saving throw or gain 1 permanent negative level.
